body.name: Nutrition Althéra
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 6 mins
features: Hypoallergenic, extensively hydrolyzed infant formula for infants from birth, or for supplementary feeding from 6 months up to 3 years of age; Contains DHA & ARA
For the dietary management of cow’s milk protein allergy.
Contains lactose, the primary carbohydrate in breast milk1
Not suitable for galactosemia, glucose-galactose malabsorption, or lactose intolerance
body.description: SMA Nutrition Althéra is a hypoallergenic, extensively hydrolyzed powdered formula intended for the dietary management of cow's milk protein allergy. It is suitable from birth or for supplementary feeding from 6 months up to 3 years of age.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #25,151 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #97 in Powder Baby Formula

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only hypoallergenic formula my baby takes
reviews.reviewText: Pros:- only hypoallergenic formula my baby accepts- no spitups.- I feel better about knowing it does have lactose.Cons:- I don't have any so far.My baby is doing great on this, gaining weight as normal and hitting milestones. It smells and taste terrible, but all the hypoallergenic formulas do. This is the only one of the hypoallergenic ones that doesn't give him painful reflux so I am grateful for that. Packaging is great and I love the 1 ounces scoops.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Baby tolerated it well
reviews.reviewText: Baby is breast fed but we used this to supplement. It was very well tolerated

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good substitute for Nutramigen
reviews.reviewText: I got this product to try for my 7 month old son who has a protein intolerance to regular milk. I was using Nutramigen for the longest time so thought I would give this a try. I’m comparison, it dissolves much quicker and doesn’t smell as bad as the Nutramigen. Measurements are different so you have to convert ml to ounces for those in US but it’s fairly easy to do that with google. I just noticed that the liquid seemed to sit on his stomach so that when I moved him after he ate I could hear it moving around in his stomach- not sure why that was. He didn’t make any fuss when I changed the formula on him which was great. Overall it worked well and could be a good option especially with the shortage in the US.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars same as nestle
reviews.reviewText: Being in the USA I wasn't familiar with this brand. But it is within the nestle company which I do know. The price point is good for this formula and after the crazy past year with shortages and recalls, I dont mind using a lesser known brand than trying to track down the big brands that everyone also is looking for. This formula I great for milk allergies or babies just generally colicky.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SMA Nutrition Althéra
reviews.reviewText: mixes great. baby liked it great for babies with milk allergies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars For babies with allergies
reviews.reviewText: High quality baby formula, dissolves very easily when preparing in a bottle. Great for babies with allergies who don’t do well with conventional formulas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not dairy-free but good digestable baby formula though lots of sugars
reviews.reviewText: While it has lots of great nutrition and vitamins and full balance for a meal for a baby or toddler that needs supplemental food, be aware it is not actually dairy-free as I thought it would be since it says it's for babies who have cow's milk allergy- but apparently they process the milk proteins and milk derivatives are super digestible so don't cause reaction to babies sensitive to milk.I would be cautious to give it to a baby who is actually allergic to milk, but if one is just sensitive, it does have ingredients that are made to be easy on the stomach and not cause irritating reactions.The sugar content is a lot but balanced with good proteins and vitamins and fats. The container has a lot of good advice and instructions and warnings.The formula mixes into water well without any grainy texture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Pretty Gross, Expensive
reviews.reviewText: My daughter does not like the taste of this at all. She'll still drink it, but she prefers it to be mixed with colder water (warm water gives a stronger taste). Bad taste isn't that surprising with hypoallergenic ingredients... I've definitely tasted worse.The scoop is small enough to work with any bottle, but doesn't have the normal hole/slit on the bottom I'm used to, so I guess it won't scoop as consistently as other brands. It's the European standard mix ratio of 1 scoop per 30mL (or 1 oz ish).I ordered this December 2022, and the tin is marked best by June 2024, so 18 months expiration from order. Made in the Netherlands by Nestle.
